hints.content:
Sequence $x$: Add $\green4$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blue8\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blue8+\green4=\pink{12}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\pink{12}+\green4=\purple{16}\end{align}$

Sequence $y$: Add $\gray2$

$\qquad\begin{align}\text{Starting term}&: \blue4\\
\text{Term 2}&:\blue4+\gray2=\pink{6}\\
\text{Term 3}&:\pink{6}+\gray2=\purple{8}\end{align}$

The  ordered pairs we want to plot are $(\blue8,\blue4), (\pink{12},\pink{6}), (\purple{16},\purple{8})$. 

$\begin{align}\blue8\times\green{\dfrac{1}{2}}&=\blue4\\
\pink{12}\times\green{\dfrac{1}{2}}&=\pink{6}\\
\purple{16}\times\green{\dfrac{1}{2}}&=\purple{8}\end{align}$

So the terms in sequence $y$ are $\green{\dfrac{1}{2}}$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

Our table of values should look like this:

$x$ | $y$ 
- | - | -
$8$ | $4$ 
$12$ | $6$ 
$16$ | $8$
$$

Our graph should look like this:

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/443d9361f7fd7778125c1c619ba1765921ff0019.png)

The terms in sequence $y$ are $\dfrac{1}{2}$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

The  ordered pairs we want to plot are $(\blue3,\blue3), (\pink7,\pink{7}), (\purple{11},\purple{11})$. 

$\begin{align}\blue3\times\green1&=\blue3\\
\pink7\times\green1&=\pink{7}\\
\purple{11}\times\green1&=\purple{11}\end{align}$

So the terms in sequence $y$ are $\green1$ times the terms in sequence $x$.

Our table of values should look like this:

$x$ | $y$ 
- | - | -
$3$ | $3$ 
$7$ | $7$ 
$11$ | $11$
$$

Our graph should look like this:

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/58d7e264441377d2a9561e28dd015bfbc9220da2.png)

The terms in sequence $y$ are $1$ times the terms in sequence $x$.
